title: [suggestion] surrender vote should disappear after 2 people vote no
body:
Hey,

I don't really see the point of keeping the surrender vote active even though 2 people voted no. Can we make it disappear when it fails, so it doesn't clog up my screen?

Is there any benefit of keeping the vote up until all players vote? 
Thanks

Another idea from the comments is for the surrender box to dissapear after you've voted. The results will be available in the chat, and the box wont be blocking your screen if you voted already. Great idea ! 

Edit: thanks so much for the support ! Lets try to get a Rioter to notice maybe they can implement it in game =D

replies.body:
There's a benefit about letting the surrender window open even after 2 people already voted "no". You can see how many members of your team want, or don't want, to surrender. If after the second "NO" vote it closed, then you wouldn't know how many players in your team really want to surrender.
You could be the only one to want the surrender (20% of the team); it could be 2 players (40%); or it could be 3 (60%).
There's a reason why it doesn't close right after the second "NO" vote and what I said might just be that reason.

However, I don't think we need the surrender window to be open a full minute after the second "no". Instead of a 2 minute surrender window it could be only 1 minute and be reduced to 30 seconds after the 2nd "no".
It's painful to see that window sitting there while the 5th member doesn't vote either "yes" or "no" for no reason; I already know that we won't surrender - yet.
You know what I think that's a totally valid compromise. Good thinking About shortening the time it stays up.

Heck why don't they have it automatically minimize after you vote already? 

Surrender window pops up.
You vote.
Surrender window disappears.
After two minutes, summary window pops up shows results (2-3 or whatever).
Window closes, game continues or ends.

I like being able to base my decision based on my teammates, but if I've already voted I don't need real time updates on what they think. Just give me the summary when they've made up their minds.
Thats a swell idea.
But when the vote is finished it says it in the chat "Surrender Vote Failed 2-3" or something like that so we already know how many people wanted to surrender
Not if they don't even get to vote. It could say "Surrender Vote Failed 1-2" in some cases here.
So the window would disappear only to those who have voted If at the same time two voted NO.

The surrender vote can fail 2-1.  If there are three guys and one votes against surrender, you're trapped in that game.  It happened to me when a three-man group rage quit and one stayed in the game to taunt me and my duo partner. He kept us in the game until the enemy team ended it.
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/7Uw7jrRX-surrender-failed-1-to-2-in-favor-of-surrendering
it marks it in chat on who dident and who voted yes

> [{quoted}](name=breakordoom444,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HgPjtR4v,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2016-07-16T13:27:05.431+0000)
>
> it marks it in chat on who dident and who voted yes

I think you missed the point. What the OP is saying is that the surrender vote should close as soon as there's a 2nd "no" vote.
Imagine this:
- Player 1 wants to surrender.
- Player 2 and 3 vote "No"
- The surrender window closes because there's already two "no" votes.
- Player 4 and 5 didn't vote "Yes" or "No" because it wouldn't make a difference to the decision.

Do you understand now what I said? This is what the OP was suggesting. There's a reason why it doesn't close automatically, even tough the "decision" is already made. It gives everyone a chance to vote yes or no, regardless of the outcome.

What I suggested is that the time window that we have, to vote either yes or no, should be shorter; especially when there's already two "no" votes.
ok thx for telling me how it acully works

I'd prefer they remove it after the player has voted.

I've already weighed in on the decision and I'll see the results in chat afterwards.

I don't need it clogging up the screen in the meantime.
Oh this is great ! I'l edit my OP to reflect this

I'm always happy to help make something more convenient for myself.

Truly, I'm such a giver.

Surrender vote should go through if 3 people vote yes and the other 2 people don't vote at all.
3/5 is the majority but not the vast majority. Are you one of thse that likes to surrender? Personally I enjoy fighting till the end

> [{quoted}](name=redfeenix,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HgPjtR4v,comment-id=00160000,timestamp=2016-07-16T17:30:48.037+0000)
>
> 3/5 is the majority but not the vast majority. Are you one of thse that likes to surrender? Personally I enjoy fighting till the end

It isn't a matter of liking to surrender, it's facing reality. In some games, there is a point in which you know for a fact that you have already lost. You see it in every elo, even master/challenger. Something will happen and then one team will just "open mid" because they know they lost already and would rather move on to the next game instead of wasting 30 more minutes trying to stall out a losing game. That is because stalling out losing games is simply inefficient. In the time it takes to stall out losing games, you could have easily made more LP by surrendering and playing more games in the long run.

But that isn't what my post was about. I was simply stating that if 3 people vote yes to surrender and the other 2 people can't even bother to press no, the vote should go through. If they vote no, I have no problem with the vote not going through.
Ohhhh so you're saying if its 3-0 click yes , they should surrender. Also if its 4-1. Makes sense.

i voted "no"

because i hit the wrong button XD
godamnit. yer butchering the integrity of the statistics !
Yeah I always yank it off my screen so I can't see it. That stupid thing tilts me.
Yes, it would be best if we didn't have to see this annoying pop-up on our screens at all.  Maybe there are players that like the pop-up, but players like me don't want to see this pop-up ever.
Just have an option in settings to deal with this. People have different preferences , and there is no right choice for all players.

Same line as the que for a game staring over when someone declines. Whats the point in everyone sitting there waiting for the bar to go all the way across when someone said No when you know your not getting in to a game this time.
Holy shit never even thought about that. If 1 person declines why do we have to get 'stuck' in that accept game screen. Good call.

Just the other day I had a game where I started a surrender vote and two people voted no, one other person voted yes, and there was one hold-out. Our Veigar then dc'd before the vote ended, and the hold-out voted yes. The vote actually passed, despite it being 3-2, because one of the "no's", Veigar, went afk.

This case, to me, seems like a pretty good reason to keep the vote up.
I don't see why not. Although I'm still willing to debate if a 3-2 vote should qualify as a surrender as well.

talking about surrender votes and not having it be about how your 4 kill team wont surrender to the obviously indestructible 20 kill enemies that then screw around for 20-30 more minutes in all quadrants of the jungle while we're barely staving off supers from all 3 angles before they finally decide they've had their fun and got enough IP/LP to finish us off and comment with gg ez, as if we already didnt know. but yeah i dont wanna see that tiny little box in the corner for a few more seconds, i hope riot do something about that over forcing their loyal, honorable players to continue obviously lost games for 20-30 minutes more than they should while slowly losing their sanity and tolerance for the game and the community. no wonder they're losing so much players....

Logged in just to upvote this. I always say that in the game chat too when 2 vote no and no one else has voted. "Whats the point of the vote staying up if 2 already voted no? is there a way to make it go away" but i don't usually get a response -_-
Cheers thanks for your support :)
Make it stay for the people who haven't voted yet but disappear for the people who voted already.
imo, if 3 out of 5 vote yes, it should go forth and give a surrender. 3 out of 5 is the majority, isn't it?
What.
what was it that you didn't understand? 3 out of 5 is the majority... A surrender vote with 3 Yes vs 2 No it should end in a surrender. It's really simple

Because you worded it wrong. You said "If 3 out of 5 vote no, it should go forth and give a surrender." What that says is if 3 people vote not to surrender, then the team surrenders anyway which is stupid.

Anyway I disagree. Four votes to surrender is fine.

I think it's a great idea, and if it took a little bit of time to disappear (so someone who wanted to make a statement by  voting yes/no, as another poster has mentioned still could), even better! I think 10 seconds after the 2nd no vote is plenty of time though, I don't see a big reason for it to linger longer than that.
bump for visibility

To be honost I dont see the point using surrender at all. So many times I'm in a game where people just give up the second they think they dont have a change of winning. And many times (when the pathetic surrender attempt fails) we win anyway.

I wonder why people bother joining a game if they give up that easy. Out of principle I never surrender so if it was up to me, I would just remove the surrender option from the game :)

Best regards,

Bamboo

I have a similar principle but sometimes, the game just seem so hopeless and even being optimistic won't change it. Mostly, the surrender option is a game play consideration because not every player has the time in the day to waste on a hopeless match.

I understand your argument since my sparetime is extremely limited due to my company and family. But when I decide to spend an hour or more (mostly latenight hehe), I 'reserved' the time to play a game. And even if I lose that game, I still want to play untill the end. I can Always learn from my mistakes and it is also out of courtesy for my and even the opposite teammembers.

Fair enough and I share the same viewpoint. 

However there are some games which I want to get out of ASAP. IE, toxic/feeding teammates, 12/0 assassins that insta kill etc, or I just need to leave IRL.

If I'm having an unenjoyable experience playing that game, I should have the right to get out of it.

I must admit, your arguments are quite understandable as well, unfortuantly... As I too run into the frustrated toxic and trolling teamm8's  a lot. Actually there should be like a banlist add-on as in the old Dota times, where we can choose not to encounter again, or at least be warned about, certain players.  The mute and report options are there,  but not quite sufficient I think.
Bump

The best solution is to allow players an option in the game settings to not have the pop-up appear at all.  This would minimize the appearance of this annoying pop-up (also auto voting "NO" as an option would be nice too).
